comment: Extremely unorganized and rude. Please don't take this class unless you absolutely have to. I've never been so stressed in my life before because of a class.

Worst professor i have ever had. He takes forever to email back, grades weird, doesn't help and sets you up for failure. I took him over summer but please take anyone else, you have a better chance at passing.

I absolutely do not like this professor, and I do not like his class. His instructions are so incredibly vague, he could have an assignment that says "Fold paper, submit" and then when you get the feedback it'll be like "You were supposed to fold at 90° angle and tilt it to the right". Don't take him unless you wanna be irritated the whole semester

he is an awful professor. he takes days to respond, he does not allow for late assignments. The directions are vague and he will never make them clear. Very difficult to deal with on the off chance that he will actually respond. Avoid Professor Negash.

This was an exciting course that was made unnecessarily hard. It was not thought out  and the students paid terribly. Too much work and your grade does not reflect it.

Avoid Dr. Negash
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: He's a relatively easy professor. Test's 1, 2, 3 account for 15%. Test 4 accounts for 20%, a few easy but tedious group projects and individuals account for like 40% and final like 20%. His accent and layout is hard to understand, but looks worse than it actually is.

The material is interesting but he makes it unnecessarily difficult to get anything done. He expects you to submit an assignment at least 3 days before its due for very vague feedback and then docks points for an expectation thats not in the syllabus. A complete waste of time for a class that should be very interesting and "innovative"
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Negash knows the material well. However, he shoved too much into a seven week class. The tests were closed notes, which with the amount of material provided, made it difficult to actually learn rather than memorize to pass the test. He's not good at clarifying assignments. Recommended only if you have prior knowledge and/ or are a fast learner.

This was a pretty easy class. We had 2 attempts per test and they aren't weighted too heavily and aren't very difficult. The first attempt I would take without studying in hopes to just pass (last semester lol) and would make between 65-70. The assignments took some time, but he graded them all lightly and they are HEAVY.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: This class is unnecessarily time consuming.4 textbooks in 4 weeks for closed book, lockdown browser tests. Semester was spent trying to get good grades rather than retaining material. Take another professor if you prefer straight forward grading criteria and not having to ask for feedback on every single assignment and quiz.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: If you ask for feedback he tells you to "Google it." (direct quote). He has no organizational process for his lecture videos and complimentary slides. Assignments are graded with no rubric, yet have expectations not specified in his instructions. There are 6 books around 350-600 pages for each book. One book a week and one test a week.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: This course crams a full 15 weeks worth of concepts into 7 weeks. You are expected to read 4 books and retain information from the books in 7 weeks. Course consist of 4 assignments and 6 test all of which are closed books, no notes, and locked down browser. It would be very hard to obtain an A in this course. Dropped the course.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Test heavy

comment: The test are not easy & are all are Webcam. The group projects are time-consuming but not very difficult. Just do exactly what he asks and follow the syllabus instructions. of you and you will get an A. He allows for an extra test and project retakes if you need it for a 90 max. He gives good feedback if you ask him.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: One of my favorite professor. I truly learn something.

Just finished the class with a B and I have to say this is probably the nicest professor Ive had at KSU. Sometimes he can be unclear, but if you just walk into his office he is very helpful. The final is 30% but if you go to class and the review its a walk in the park. He doesnt tell you about a cheat sheet but if you ask he says you can use one

Negash is a really nice guy. His lectures are relevant to the 4 projects that make up most of the class. If you genuinely care about getting a good grade, he is more than happy to sit down with you and teach you how to do the projects one on one. He's a little nit-picky about the details, but allows you to resubmit every project for up to a 90.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: This class is made up of 5 assignments, 1 test, and an app development project. At the beginning I was very confused because he doesn't walk you through how to do the flowcharts or psuedocode but just read the book! The class was fun and a great learning experience! Put in the effort and you will see an A!

You will work for your A or B. Do the work and you'll do fine, don't and your GPA will suffer. Heavy reading of material. We had 6 quizzes, 4 paper assignments, and a final project. The final project is time consuming and difficult. Make sure you ask him what he is looking for in the assignments and final. Overall decent professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--TEST HEAVY

comment: The guy is one of the most unorganized professors i've taken at KSU. You never really know what to expect and if you dont show up to class, expect an F, because he basically wings the whole semester. He changed the exams from online to in class halfway through the semester, never experienced anything like that.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Don't get me wrong, Professor Negash is a very nice helpful professor.   He is always willing to help and wants his students to do their best.  However his tests and quizzes are difficult and include multiple choice and essay questions.  He wants your answers in a specific way and if it is not, your grade suffers.  Overall I would take again.
Do your work and you will pass. His grading is a little confusing but it is fair. Easy A!

IS - 3020 Application Development. This class is way to easy, Kennesaw needs to update their material. Visual Basic are you serious. If you want to know what you'll make prior to taking the class then this is the class for you. He gives you everything on D2L and reading the book is a must. Slow paced but lectures are crammed.

Answered emailed questions right away. Very helpful, wants you to succeed. Just do the assignments and its an Easy A or B. As long as you don't wait until the last minute the work load isn't bad.  You will need to read the chapters to pass the quizzes. At the very least print off the slides and do the practice quizzes.

Take someone else if you can. He is extremely boring and very unclear. While his class was somewhat easy, it was dreadful because his lectures are so dry. He doesn't have clear expectations and cuts points for dumb stuff. He doesn't take attendance so I only went a few times.

This professor changed the class FtF time to only online w video chat due to his business travel. I paid for some FtF time? Nice guy, but not quick at returning email. I was behind from day one. He's the only prof teaching this class making the IS program very 2D. Its a neat class, find a partner to bounce work off. KSU needs more talent.

I would not recommend this preofessor at all. Its a hybrid class but doesn't tell you that till the first day of class. An assignment and quiz due everyweek. Assignments are very hard, not even the lazy type I do my homework and everything they are just really hard! 2 test. Term project at the end with a software he vagely teaches you how to use.

Negash isn't the greatest professor however, the class itself (IS 3020 App Dev) is really easy. He assigns 6 HW assignments that are pretty simple and then 2 tests. It would serve best to find a buddy in the class who can help with the coding as Negash is hard to understand. He will make time to help tho if you need it. Not a bad class at all.

This "professor" is an incompetent buffoon. His grading is whimsically subjective at best, and he doesn't understand the material he's trying to teach. He also docks points from assignments because you don't read his mind and include aspects not listed on the assignment. The only excuse I ever got for docked points was "Well it doesn't matter"

The tests are quite hard and the group project at the end of the semester is time consuming.  The information you learn about project management is useful, however.  The professor goes off on a lot of tangents as well.  However, the material is good and you pretty much get what you put into it.  Average class; Average professor for this program.

Good class.  Prof sometimes had trouble remembering how to do some things.  Couldn't grasp what my term project was about.  Class alternates between boredom and frantic coding. Final was at school, but outside of class time and in the middle of the afternoon, during work hours!.

Negash is very helpful in that he walks through a practice problem in class before each assignment and demonstrates how to fulfill the upcoming assignment's requirements. He also helps students with any coding questions or errors they may be experiencing in their own applications. Just come to class and learn the material and you will do fine.

Professor Negash is unpredicatable.He gives you the grades on the mini quizzes just off the top of his head and I'm sure he does something similiar for the final grade. Calculating my grade didn't match up to what he posted on owl express. He didn't drop our lowerst grades like the syllabus said, most students beleive.Gives lots of examples though.

Very boring and has an atrocious accent.  Knows his stuff though.  Practice outside the classroom is required; you can't just do the homework once and expect to "get it."  Generally helpful when you ask but is nitpicky when it comes to assignment grading.  Follow instructions TO THE LETTER and do not deviate even when you think you know better.

People complaining about him in the VB class likely did not do the work.  Any coding class requires that you not only read the book, but practice the coding methods over and over.  I think its silly to give the professor a bad rating when you didn't do your part of the work.  He knows and understands VB and has industry relevant experience.
Please dont change syllabus as you like. We want to learn in class and not writing papers for your "book".

Soloman Negash is a nice guy, but he's unorganized, changes up the syllabus way too much, doesn't know much about Visual Basic (we had to teach him and we're just learning ourselves), and he can't spell despite having a PhD. I guess he's about par for the course in the IS program at KSU. Disappointing to say the least. A waste of time and tuition.

He is the worst teacher I have ever had.  I think that the class is better off being an online class where you don't get confused by a man who has a very heavy accent that is very hard to understand.  I think that he has chose the wrong career path and he needs to be working where he only works on computers instead of working with people. No Good!

IS 8050 is a Project Management Class. This teacher does not teach PM effectively and grades homework as he likes. He does not possess enough credentials and experiences to teach this class. Yes, he has all those technical degrees but generally managers are not technical people! Replacement will benefit Kennesaw students greatly.

IS 8050/Is 4840/IS 4841 I couldnt be more disappointed with a teacher as far as the capstone course. Very boring, puts forth very little effort towards students as far as their learning,very involved with himself & his work.Gives work, no explanation and just hammers you.Would not ever take again & do not recommend.One of the worst teachers in IS
Dr. Negash is an excellent professor.  Just do the work, write the paper, and stay on task and you will earn an A.  He prepares you for life as well as grad school.

If you want to learn something in your course, take Dr. Negash. He makes lectures very interesting. You never get bored. He has a lot of experience in the real world, plus he's got like 5 degrees!! He is so helpful in understanding material. He does give a lot of work, but you truly feel that learned so many things worth mentioning in your resume.

At first the class was VERY confusing. The group project is kinda thrown on you the first day and you probably wont figure out whats going on until it's a week from being due but it should eventually come together! Tests fairly easy, you can use one full page of notes/cheat sheet. Lectures a little on the boring side, a lot of repeat info from BISM
He cares about your aquiring knowledge and he knows the material.  I would take any class from Dr. Negash.  He is very fair.  Make sure you team up with a group that everyone holds their load.

Good teacher, excellent for those IS majors.  Know his stuff and you cannot ask for more..do your part in the team and make sure you are in a team that will work 'AS A TEAM' will take any class from him.
The best teacher I ever had. Just do the assignments and you`ll get an A. He will guide you well throughout the project just make sure you select a good project manager in your team
Anything that you hear regarding lots of work is correct, but I had lots of fun.
big group project expected.expect many assignment.be on top of thing and you will basically make an A
A huge group project is expected.  I was in his first class ever, and a lot of the assignments were very ambiguous.  Tests are easy and he is a nice guy.  Stay on top of things and get an "A!"
